PAGE.TITLE: Differentiation
PAGE.DESCRIPTION:
If we have a function $F(x)$ then its derivative, $\frac{\textrm{d}F(x)}{\textrm{d}x}$, is defined as:
$$
\frac{\textrm{d}F(x)}{\textrm{d}x} = \lim_{\epsilon \rightarrow 0} \frac{ F(x+\epsilon) - F(x) }{ \epsilon }
$$

UL.LI: You should be able to write out an expression that defines the derivative of a function as a limit.
You should be able to find the derivatives of functions by taking the above limit.
You should be able to find the derivatives of $x^n$ and $e^{\lambda x}$ with respect to $x$.
